text: Walther Gottlieb Louis Leisler Kiep (5 January 1926 - 9 May 2016) was a German politician. He was a member of the Christian Democratic Union (CDU). He was a member of the Bundestag between 1965 and 1976 and again from 1980 to 1982. After switching to state-level politics, he served as Minister of Economy (1976–77) and Minister of Finance (1976–80) in Lower Saxony under Ernst Albrecht. In 1982, Kiep was the leading candidate for the CDU in two state elections in Hamburg. From 1971 until 1992, he was treasurer of his party at the federal level. Kiep died on 9 May 2016 in his home in Kronberg im Taunus in Hesse of pneumonia, aged 90. ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:Disease-related deaths in Germany Category:Members of the German Bundestag Category:Politicians from Hamburg Category:Politicians of the Christian Democratic Union of Germany
title: Walther Leisler Kiep
